ðŸš€ cloudypad | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Deploying and managing a personal cloud gaming server to stream games without requiring a powerful local machine or a subscription.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Cloud gaming platform alternative â€¢ Stream games with Moonlight â€¢ Supports Steam, Pegasus, and Lutris
ðŸ“– Summary: Cloudy Pad is an open-source alternative to cloud gaming platforms like GeForce Now, allowing users to deploy their own gaming server on various cloud providers. It supports streaming via Moonlight, integrates with game launchers like Steam and Lutris, and offers cost management features such as spot instance utilization and automated shutdowns, providing a pay-as-you-go cloud gaming experience.

ðŸŒŸ browsh | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Browsing the web on low-bandwidth connections or resource-constrained devices.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Text-based browser â€¢ TTY rendering â€¢ Headless Firefox backend â€¢ Bandwidth optimization â€¢ SSH/MoSH support
ðŸ“– Summary: Browsh is a text-based browser that utilizes a headless Firefox instance to render modern web pages in a terminal or another browser. It's designed for use in situations with limited bandwidth or on devices with low processing power, allowing users to access the web via SSH or MoSH connections.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ packemon | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Generating and monitoring network packets for debugging, testing, and security analysis.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Packet generation with customizable network interfaces â€¢ Packet monitoring on specified network interfaces â€¢ TUI interface for packet analysis â€¢ Packet filtering â€¢ Detailed packet view
ðŸ“– Summary: PackÃ©mon is a TUI tool for generating and monitoring network packets. It allows users to craft and send custom packets over specified network interfaces and observe network traffic in real-time. The tool provides features for packet filtering and detailed packet analysis, making it suitable for network debugging, testing, and security assessments.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ tracy | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Performance analysis and optimization of games and other applications.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Real-time profiling â€¢ Nanosecond resolution â€¢ Remote telemetry â€¢ Hybrid frame and sampling profiler â€¢ CPU profiling (C, C++, Lua, Python, Fortran)
ðŸ“– Summary: Tracy is a real-time, nanosecond-resolution profiler designed for analyzing the performance of applications, particularly games. It supports CPU and GPU profiling, memory allocation tracking, lock contention analysis, and context switch monitoring. Tracy offers remote telemetry and hybrid frame/sampling profiling capabilities, with direct support for C, C++, Lua, Python, and Fortran, as well as bindings for other languages.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ openresty-manager | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Host management and reverse proxy setup with a focus on ease of use and security.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Web management UI â€¢ Free SSL support â€¢ Reverse proxy creation â€¢ Host management (terminal and file manager) â€¢ Application store
ðŸ“– Summary: OpenResty Manager is a host management panel designed as an open-source alternative to OpenResty Edge. It simplifies the process of securing reverse proxy websites, managing hosts, and deploying applications through a user-friendly web interface and an application store. It also automates free SSL certificate management and provides tools for access control and denial of service protection.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ ScreenToGif | C#
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Recording screen activity, webcam feed, or sketchboard drawings and saving them as GIFs or videos.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Screen recording â€¢ Webcam recording â€¢ Sketchboard recording â€¢ GIF creation â€¢ Video creation
ðŸ“– Summary: ScreenToGif is a tool for recording a selected area of your screen, live webcam feed, or sketchboard drawings. It allows users to edit the recordings and save them as GIFs, videos, or other image formats. The application provides a comprehensive solution for creating and editing screen recordings for various purposes.
